title: (x) Land Registry typeface - custom designed by Dalton Maag {Geoff}
content:
Anyone know the name of the typeface used on this site's logo and buttons, please?  
Or anything that's very similar.  
 [http://www.landreg.gov.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061643/http:/www.landreg.gov.uk/ "http://www.landreg.gov.uk/")  
Thanks
author: T Bones

comments.content: Well, according to a PDF I downloaded from their site, there are several GEO-fonts used: Geo, Geo-Bold, Geo-BoldItalic, GeoHeadline. But I haven't found a reference for it. As a substitute I'd recommend Neo Tech, Neo Sans, Digital Sans or the Hans Reichel-fonts like barmeno/Sari or even Dax.

Custom [Property](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061643/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/custom/clients/landregistry?offset=2) type designed by Dalton Maag, probably called Geo as Rainer has found in the PDF.
An another alternative is MÃ¡rio Feliciano's [Mandrax.](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061643/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/feliciano/bs-mandrax/)
